newsitem.title: USA: Virginia sees boost in economic development.
newsitem.headline: Virginia sees boost in economic development.

text.p: Forty-five companies announced plans to move into or expand in Virginia during the second quarter of 1996, creating 7,000 new jobs, the state Economic Development Partnership said Wednesday.
The number of new jobs rose by 34 percent over the second quarter of last year, while the value of the planned investment rose by 500 percent during the period, to $2.1 billion.

The largest of the expansions was announced by White Oak Semiconductor, a joint venture between Siemens and Motorola that will make semiconductor chips in Henrico County. It accounted for 1,500 jobs and $1.5 billion.

Robert Skunda, Virginia Secretary of Commerce and Trade, said the White Oak project was expected to spur additional economic investment in the region, while overall manufacturing growth remained strong.
